intro: Brodiaea felipponei, commonly known as the Felippone's brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous structure. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
